str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
Divinity, divine nature. From theios; divinity.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To see clearly, perceive, discern. From kata and horao; to behold fully, i.e. distinctly apprehend.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: From nous; to exercise the mind, i.e. to comprehend, heed.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A thing made, a work, workmanship. From poieo; a product, i.e. Fabric.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Without (ground of) defense, indefensible, inexcusable. Indefensible.
